column4: I'm running Ubuntu 8.10 Hardy Heron and now when I attempt to boot it it brings me to the BusyBox shell. Why would this be? Only a week ago at most it was perfectly fine.. I need to get into Ubuntu to copy files to my file server as my Window's installation's security has been compromised.
Anyone? I'd really like to get backing up my files. Does anyone have any idea why I'd suddenly be getting the BusyBox shell?
did you do any recent updates?
Last time I was in it it installed a mass amount of updates, but I'm pretty sure I rebooted back into Ubuntu just to make sure it all worked out.
